ARABIC: وَشَرَوْهُ بِثَمَنٍۭ بَخْسٍ دَرَٰهِمَ مَعْدُودَةٍ وَكَانُوا۟ فِيهِ مِنَ ٱلزَّٰهِدِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They sold him for a pittance, a few small coins, considering him to be of little worth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And they sold him as worthless for a few paltry dirham.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Later they sold him for a paltry sum - just a few dirhams; they did not care to obtain a higher price.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: In selling him they asked for a very small price and even then no one wanted to buy him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the brothers sold him for an improper price, a limited number of coins; and they had no interest in him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And they sold him for a Bakhs price, - for a few Dirhams. And they were of those who regarded him insignificant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And they sold him for a small price, a few pieces of silver, and they showed no desire for him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Then they sold him for a paltry price, a handful of counted dirhams; for they set small store by him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And they sold him for a low price, a number of silver coins; and they attached no value to him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Later they sold him for a paltry sum, a few pieces of silver [dirhams]: So little did they value him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And they sold him for a mean price: a few dirhams numbered and they were in regard to him of the indifferent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And they sold him for a cheap price, a few dirhams, for they set small store by him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The (Brethren) sold him for a miserable price, for a few dirhams counted out: in such low estimation did they hold him!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And they sold him for a low price, - for a few Dirhams (i.e. for a few silver coins). And they were of those who regarded him insignificant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Then, they sold him for a trifling price, a number of dirhams, because they considered him to be of little value.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And they sold him for a cheap price—a few coins—they considered him to be of little value.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And they sold him for a reduced price - a few dirhams - and they were, concerning him, of those content with little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [12:20]   Then they sold him — they [the caravan] purchased him from them — for a very low, a diminished, price, a handful of dirhams, 20 or 22; for they, that is, his brothers, set small store by him. So the caravan brought him to Egypt, where the one who had bought him sold him for 20 dinars, two pairs of sandals and two robes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And they sold him) the brothers of Malik Ibn Du'ar bought him (for a low price) by cheating in weight; it is also said that he was bought with false money; and it was also said that he was bought with unlawful money, (a number of silver coins) 20 silver coins; it is also said: 32 silver coins; (and they attached no value to him) they were reluctant to buy him because they did not need him; it is also said that the brothers of 244 Joseph attached no importance to Joseph because they did not know his standing and stature with Allah, Exalted is He. It is also said that the people of the caravan attached no value to Joseph.
